company.name: Action Research Group, Inc.
company.address: 2263 W. New Haven Avenue, Melbourne, Florida
company.business_description: Action Research Group, Inc. obtained confidential customer phone records from telecommunications carriers and sold such records to clients and others for a fee, using false pretenses, fraudulent statements, and misrepresentations to induce disclosure of the records.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Defendants obtained and sold confidential customer phone records without account holders' authorization by using false pretenses, fraudulent statements, and misrepresentations, including posing as account holders or telecommunications carrier employees. Since at least September 2005, they induced telecommunications carriers to disclose call records and sold this information to clients for a fee. This unauthorized access and sale caused substantial harm to consumers including loss of privacy and endangering health and safety.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be specifically-identified account holders seeking their own phone records
representations_made.quoted_text: In numerous instances, in the course and conduct of their business, Defendants directly or through their employees and agents, expressly or by implication, have represented or caused others to represent to telecommunications carriers: (i) that they are specifically-identified account holders with those carriers seeking disclosure of confidential customer phone records for their own benefit

representations_made.description: Claimed to be employees of telecommunications carriers
representations_made.quoted_text: (ii) that they are employees of the carriers seeking disclosure of the confidential customer phone records of the actual account holder

representations_made.description: Claimed to be otherwise authorized to seek disclosure of customer phone records
representations_made.quoted_text: (iii) that they are otherwise authorized to seek disclosure of confidential customer phone records

counts.title: Deceptive Misrepresentations to Carriers
counts.representation: Defendants represented to telecommunications carriers that they were account holders, carrier employees, or otherwise authorized to obtain confidential customer phone records
counts.fact: In truth and in fact, Defendants are not the specifically-identified account holders with those carriers, employees of the carriers, or otherwise authorized to seek disclosure of confidential customer phone records
counts.conclusion: Defendants' misrepresentations as set forth above constitute deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

counts.title: Unfair Obtaining and Selling of Phone Records
counts.representation: Defendants obtained and sold to third parties confidential customer phone records without the knowledge or consent of the customer
counts.fact: Defendants' practices in obtaining and selling to third parties confidential customer phone records have caused or are likely to cause substantial injury to consumers that is not reasonably avoidable by consumers and is not outweighed by countervailing benefits to consumers or competition
counts.conclusion: Therefore, Defendants' practices as set forth above constitute unfair practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a).

definitions.Defendants: Action Research Group, Inc., its successors and assigns, Joseph Depante, and Matthew Depante.
definitions.Corporate Defendant: Action Research Group, Inc. and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Customer phone records: (a) information that relates to the quantity, technical configuration, type, destination, location, and amount of use of a telecommunications service subscribed to by any customer of a telecommunications carrier, and that is made available to the carrier by the customer solely by virtue of the carrier-customer relationship; and (b) information contained in the bills pertaining to telephone exchange service or telephone toll service received by a customer of a carrier, which includes, but is not limited to, telephone call detail records.
definitions.Consumer personal information: any individually identifiable information concerning a consumer, including, but not limited to: (a) an unpublished or unlisted wire line or wireless phone number; (b) an unpublished or unlisted physical or mailing address, including street name and name of city or town, Post Office Box number, or Private Mailbox number; (c) an email address or other online contact information, such as an instant messaging user identifier or a screen name that reveals an individual's email address; (d) a Social Security number in whole or in part; (e) credit and/or debit card information, including credit and/or debit card number, expiration date, data stored on the magnetic strip of a credit or debit card, and transaction detail records; (f) bank account information or transaction records including the ABA routing number, account number, check number, and transaction detail records; (g) a driver's license number; or (h) any other information from or about an individual consumer that is combined with (a) through (g) above.

provisions.title: Ban on Sale of Customer Phone Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from obtaining, causing others to obtain, marketing, or selling customer phone records and consumer personal information derived from customer phone records, except when authorized by law, regulation, or court order.

requirements.description: Must not obtain, cause others to obtain, market, or sell customer phone records and consumer personal information derived from customer phone records
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that Defendants and their agents, servants, salespersons, employees, independent contractors, attorneys, and those persons in active concert or participation with them, whether acting directly or through any sole proprietorship, partnership, limited liability company, corporation, subsidiary, branch, division, or other entity, who receive actual notice of this Order by personal service or otherwise, are hereby restrained and enjoined from obtaining, causing others to obtain, marketing, or selling customer phone records and consumer personal information that is derived from customer phone records; provided, however, that Defendants shall not be prohibited from obtaining customer phone records or consumer personal information that is derived from customer phone records pursuant to any law, regulation, or lawful court order.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from making false or deceptive statements to obtain consumer personal information and from requesting others to obtain such information through deceptive means.

requirements.description: Must not make false or deceptive statements or representations, including impersonating any person or entity, to obtain consumer personal information
requirements.quoted_text: Making false or deceptive statements or representations, including but not limited to impersonating any person or entity, directly or by implication, to any person or entity in order to obtain consumer personal information

requirements.description: Must not request any person or entity to obtain consumer personal information if the person making the request knows or should know that the information will be obtained in violation of Subsection A
requirements.quoted_text: Requesting any person or entity to obtain consumer personal information relating to any third person, if the person making such a request knows or should know that the person or entity to whom such a request is made will obtain or attempt to obtain such information in violation of Subsection A of Section II.

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: A judgment of $67,000 is entered against Defendants, suspended upon payment of $3,000 to the FTC and absent any finding of material misrepresentation regarding assets.

requirements.description: Pay $3,000 to the FTC to suspend judgment of $67,000
requirements.quoted_text: Judgment is hereby entered against Defendants, jointly and severally, in the amount of SIXTY SEVEN THOUSAND DOLLARS ($67,000.00); provided, however, that this judgment shall be suspended (1) upon the transfer of $3,000 to the FTC or its designated agent; and (2) as long as the Court makes no finding, as provided in Section IV of this Order, that any defendant materially misrepresented or omitted the nature, existence, or value of any asset.

requirements.description: Furnish tax identification numbers to the FTC for collection and reporting purposes
requirements.quoted_text: Defendants are hereby required, in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701, to furnish to the FTC their tax identification numbers, which shall be used for purposes of collecting and reporting on any delinquent amount arising out of this Order.

provisions.title: Right to Reopen
provisions.summary: If the Court finds material misrepresentation or omission in Defendants' financial statements, the suspended judgment becomes immediately due and payable.

requirements.description: Suspended judgment becomes immediately due if financial statement contains material misrepresentation or omission
requirements.quoted_text: If, upon motion by the FTC, the Court finds that the financial statement of any Defendant contains any material misrepresentation or omission, the suspended judgment entered in Section III of this Order shall become immediately due and payable as to that Defendant (less any amounts turned over to the FTC pursuant to Section III(A) of this Order)

provisions.title: Cooperation with FTC
provisions.summary: Defendants must cooperate in good faith with the FTC in connection with this action or any subsequent related investigations, including appearing for interviews, depositions, and testimony.

requirements.description: Cooperate in good faith with the FTC and appear for interviews, conferences, pretrial discovery, review of documents, and other matters as reasonably requested
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants shall, in connection with this action or any subsequent investigations related to or associated with the transactions or the occurrences that are the subject of the FTC's Complaint, cooperate in good faith with the FTC and appear at such places and times as the FTC shall reasonably request, after written notice, for interviews, conferences, pretrial discovery, review of documents, and for such other matters as may be reasonably requested by the FTC.

requirements.description: If requested in writing, appear and provide truthful testimony in any trial, deposition, or other proceeding without service of a subpoena
requirements.quoted_text: If requested in writing by the FTC, Defendants shall appear and provide truthful testimony in any trial, deposition, or other proceeding related to or associated with the transactions or the occurrences that are the subject of the Complaint, without the service of a subpoena

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, business inspections, posing as consumers, and interviewing personnel.

requirements.description: Within ten days of receipt of written notice from the FTC, submit additional written reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, and/or provide entry to business locations for inspection
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the FTC, Defendants each shall submit additional written reports, which are true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury; produce documents for inspection and copying; appear for deposition; and/or provide entry during normal business hours to any business location in each such Defendant's possession or direct or indirect control, to inspect the business operation.

requirements.description: Permit representatives of the FTC to interview any employer, consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview
requirements.quoted_text: Defendants each shall permit representatives of the FTC to interview any employer, consultant, independent contractor, representative, agent, or employee who has agreed to such an interview, relating in any way to any conduct subject to this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business structure, and file periodic compliance reports at 180 days and annually thereafter.

requirements.description: Individual Defendants must notify the FTC of any changes in residence, mailing addresses, and telephone numbers within fifteen days
requirements.quoted_text: Any changes in his residence, mailing addresses, and telephone numbers, within fifteen (15) days of the date of such change

requirements.description: Individual Defendants must notify the FTC of any changes in employment status or ownership in any business entity within fifteen days
requirements.quoted_text: Any changes in his employment status (including self-employment), and any change in his ownership in any business entity, within fifteen (15) days of the date of such change. Such notice shall include the name and address of each business that he is affiliated with, employed by, creates, forms, or performs services for; a detailed description of the nature of the business; and a detailed description of his duties and responsibilities in connection with the business or employment

requirements.description: Defendants must notify the FTC of any changes in structure of Corporate Defendant or any business entity that may affect compliance obligations at least thirty days prior to such change
requirements.quoted_text: Defendants shall notify the FTC of any changes in structure of Corporate Defendant or any business entity that any Defendant directly or indirectly controls, or has an ownership interest in, that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including but not limited to incorporation or other organization; a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor entity; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order; or a change in the business name or address, at least thirty (30) days prior to such change; provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the business entity about which a Defendant learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, such Defendant shall notify the FTC as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

requirements.description: Defendants must provide a written compliance report at 180 days after entry of this Order and annually thereafter for three years
requirements.quoted_text: One hundred and eighty (180) days after the date of entry of this Order and annually thereafter for a period of three (3) years, Defendants each shall provide a written report to the FTC, which is true and accurate and sworn to under penalty of perjury, setting forth in detail the manner and form in which they have complied and are complying with this Order.

requirements.description: Defendants must notify the FTC of the filing of a bankruptcy petition within fifteen days of filing
requirements.quoted_text: Defendants shall notify the FTC of the filing of a bankruptcy petition by any Defendant within fifteen (15) days of filing

provisions.title: Record Keeping
provisions.summary: For six years, Defendants must create and retain comprehensive business records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, third-party contracts, and compliance documents.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records that reflect cost of goods or services sold, revenues generated, and disbursement of revenues
requirements.quoted_text: Accounting records that reflect the cost of goods or services sold, revenues generated, and the disbursement of such revenues

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records accurately reflecting name, address, telephone number, job title, date of commencement, and date and reason for termination of each employee
requirements.quoted_text: Personnel records accurately reflecting: the name, address, and telephone number of each person employed in any capacity by such business, including as an independent contractor; that person's job title or position; the date upon which the person commenced work; and the date and reason for the person's termination, if applicable

requirements.description: Create and retain customer files containing names, addresses, phone numbers, dollar amounts paid, quantity and description of goods or services purchased
requirements.quoted_text: Customer files containing the names, addresses, phone numbers, dollar amounts paid, quantity of goods or services purchased, and description of goods or services purchased, to the extent such information is obtained in the ordinary course of business

requirements.description: Create and retain complaints and refund requests and any responses to those complaints or requests
requirements.quoted_text: Complaints and refund requests (whether received directly, indirectly, or through any third party) and any responses to those complaints or requests

requirements.description: Create and retain copies of all sales scripts, training materials, advertisements, or other marketing materials, and records reflecting time periods and persons who used such materials
requirements.quoted_text: Copies of all sales scripts, training materials, advertisements, or other marketing materials, and records that accurately reflect the time periods during which such materials were used and the persons and business entities that used such materials

requirements.description: Create and retain records reflecting the name, address, and telephone number of third parties used to obtain consumer personal information, including copies of all contracts and correspondence
requirements.quoted_text: To the extent consumer personal information is obtained through the use of any third party, records that accurately reflect the name, address, and telephone number of such third party, including, but not limited to, copies of all contracts and correspondence (other than correspondence that contains consumer personal information) between any Defendant and such third party

requirements.description: Create and retain all records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: All records and documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including but not limited to, acknowledgments of receipt of this Order, required by Sections IX and X, and all reports submitted to the FTC pursuant to Section VII.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years, Defendants must deliver copies of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter, and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Corporate Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to current personnel within five days of service of the Order
requirements.quoted_text: Corporate Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, and managers, and all employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order. For current personnel, delivery shall be within five (5) days of service of this Order upon Corporate Defendant.

requirements.description: Corporate Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to new personnel prior to them assuming their responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: For new personnel, delivery shall occur prior to them assuming their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Individual Defendants as control persons must deliver a copy of this Order to current personnel within five days of service of the Order
requirements.quoted_text: For any business entity that an Individual Defendant controls, directly or indirectly, or in which such Individual Defendant has a majority ownership interest, such Individual Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, and managers, and all employees, agents, and representatives who engage in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order. For current personnel, delivery shall be within five (5) days of service of this Order upon the Individual Defendant.

requirements.description: Individual Defendants as control persons must deliver a copy of this Order to new personnel prior to them assuming their responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: For new personnel, delivery shall occur prior to them assuming their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Individual Defendants as employees or non-control persons must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals and managers before engaging in conduct related to the subject matter
requirements.quoted_text: For any business where an Individual Defendant is not a controlling person of a business but otherwise engages in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order, such Individual Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals and managers of such business entity before engaging in such conduct.

requirements.description: Each Defendant must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within thirty days of delivery
requirements.quoted_text: Each Defendant must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of the Order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the Order pursuant to this Section.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the FTC acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days.

requirements.description: Submit to the FTC a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that each Defendant, within five (5) business days of receipt of this Order as entered by the Court, must submit to the FTC a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

duration.termination_text: This Court shall retain jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
